info.title: F5 Distributed Cloud Services API for ves.io.schema.topology
info.description:
APIs to get topology of all the resources associated/connected to a site such as other CEs (Customer Edge),
REs (Regional Edge), VPCs (Virtual Private Cloud) networks, etc., and the associated metrics. Relationship between
the resources associated with a site is represented as a graph, where each resource/entity is represented as a node
(example: CE, RE, VPC, Subnet, etc.,) and their association is represented as edge (example: CE - RE connection,
Network - Subnets association, etc.,)

post.description: Get topology of a DC Cluster.

401.description: Returned when operation is not authorized

403.description: Returned when there is no permission to access resource

404.description: Returned when resource is not found

409.description: Returned when operation on resource is conflicting with current value

429.description: Returned when operation has been rejected as it is happening too frequently

500.description: Returned when server encountered an error in processing API

503.description: Returned when service is unavailable temporarily

504.description: Returned when server timed out processing request

ioschemaObjectRefType.description:
This type establishes a 'direct reference' from one object(the referrer) to another(the referred).
Such a reference is in form of tenant/namespace/name for public API and Uid for private API
This type of reference is called direct because the relation is explicit and concrete (as opposed
to selector reference which builds a group based on labels of selectee objects)
ioschemaObjectRefType.title: ObjectRefType

kind.description:

schemaIpSubnetType.description: IP Address used to specify an IPv4 or IPv6 subnet addresses
schemaIpSubnetType.title: IP Subnet

schemaIpv4SubnetType.description: IPv4 subnets specified as prefix and prefix-length. Prefix length must be <= 32
schemaIpv4SubnetType.title: IPv4 Subnet

plen.description:
Prefix-length of the IPv4 subnet. Must be <= 32

Example: ` "24"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 32
plen.title: Prefix Length

prefix.description:
Prefix part of the IPv4 subnet in string form with dot-decimal notation

Example: ` "192.168.1.0"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.ipv4: true
prefix.title: Prefix

schemaIpv6SubnetType.description: IPv6 subnets specified as prefix and prefix-length. prefix-legnth must be <= 128
schemaIpv6SubnetType.title: IPv6 Subnet

plen.description:
Prefix length of the IPv6 subnet. Must be <= 128

Example: ` "38"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.uint32.lte: 128
plen.title: Prefix length

prefix.description:
Prefix part of the IPv6 subnet given in form of string.
 IPv6 address must be specified as hexadecimal numbers separated by ':'
 e.g. "2001:db8:0:0:0:2:0:0"
 The address can be compacted by suppressing zeros
 e.g. "2001:db8::2::"

Example: ` "2001:db8:0:0:0:0:2:0"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.ipv6: true
prefix.title: Prefix

schemaUnitType.title: UnitType

schemaVirtualNetworkType.description:
Different types of virtual networks understood by the system

Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL provides connectivity to public (outside) network.
This is an insecure network and is connected to public internet via NAT Gateways/firwalls
Virtual-network of this type is local to every site. Two virtual networks of this type on different
sites are neither related nor connected.

Constraints:
There can be atmost one virtual network of this type in a given site.
This network type is supported on CE sites. This network is created automatically and present on all sites
Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL_INSIDE is a private network inside site.
It is a secure network and is not connected to public network.
Virtual-network of this type is local to every site. Two virtual networks of this type on different
sites are neither related nor connected.

Constraints:
There can be atmost one virtual network of this type in a given site.
This network type is supported on CE sites. This network is created during provisioning of site
User defined per-site virtual network. Scope of this virtual network is limited to the site.
This is not yet supported
Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_PUBLIC directly conects to the public internet.
Virtual-network of this type is local to every site. Two virtual networks of this type on different sites are neither related nor connected.

Constraints:
There can be atmost one virtual network of this type in a given site.
This network type is supported on RE sites only
It is an internally created by the system. They must not be created by user
Virtual Neworks with global scope across different sites in F5XC domain.
An example global virtual-network called "AIN Network" is created for every tenant.
for volterra fabric

Constraints:
It is currently only supported as internally created by the system.
vK8s service network for a given tenant. Used to advertise a virtual host only to vk8s pods for that tenant
Constraints:
It is an internally created by the system. Must not be created by user
VER internal network for the site. It can only be used for virtual hosts with SMA_PROXY type proxy
Constraints:
It is an internally created by the system. Must not be created by user
Virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL_INSIDE_OUTSIDE represents both
VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL and VIRTUAL_NETWORK_SITE_LOCAL_INSIDE

Constraints:
This network type is only meaningful in an advertise policy
When virtual-network of type VIRTUAL_NETWORK_IP_AUTO is selected for
an endpoint, VER will try to determine the network based on the provided
IP address

Constraints:
This network type is only meaningful in an endpoint

VoltADN Private Network is used on volterra RE(s) to connect to customer private networks
This network is created by opening a support ticket

This network is per site srv6 network
VER IP Fabric network for the site.
This Virtual network type is used for exposing virtual host on IP Fabric network on the VER site or
for endpoint in IP Fabric network
Constraints:
It is an internally created by the system. Must not be created by user
Network internally created for a segment
Constraints:
It is an internally created by the system. Must not be created by user
schemaVirtualNetworkType.title: VirtualNetworkType

schematopologyLinkType.description:
Enumerates the association/relationship between 2 nodes.

Indicates that 2 nodes are connected using a tunnel
Indicates network connection
Indicates connection to subnet
Indicates connection to instance
Indicates association with site mesh group
Indicates association with DC Cluster group
Indicates L3 connection between the nodes
Indicates the Control plane connection between the nodes
Indicates the BGP connection between the tgw and site
schematopologyLinkType.title: LinkType

schematopologyMetricType.description:
List of metric types applicable for the nodes and edges in the topology graph.
Not all metric types are applicable for all nodes or edges. For example, LATENCY metric
is applicable only for the edges where both the vertices are sites and CPU_USAGE metric is
applicable only for node of type instance. This list is a union of all metric types.

Total incoming traffic in bytes
Total outgoing traffic in bytes
Total incoming packets dropped
Total outgoing packets dropped
Reachability based on probes sent periodically
Average latency in seconds
Average CPU utilization in percentage
Average Memory utilization in percentage
Average Disk utilization in percentage
Connection status of the tunnel
Control plane connection status of the tunnel
schematopologyMetricType.title: Metric Type

schematopologyMetricTypeData.description:
Metric Type Data contains key that uniquely identifies individual entity and its corresponding metric values.
For example, if an instance contains multiple interfaces, then the key contains the name/value pair that identifies
the interface name of the instance.
schematopologyMetricTypeData.title: Metric Type Data

labels.description:
Labels contains the name/value pair that uniquely identifies an entity whose metric is being reported.
 If the Labels is empty, then the metric value is for the corresponding node or edge.
 For example, if an instance contains multiple interfaces, then the labels contains the name/value pairs that identifies
 the interface name of the instance.
labels.title: Labels

values.description: List of metric values. May contain more than one value if timeseries data is requested.
values.title: Value

schematopologyNode.description: Canonical representation of Node in the topology graph.
schematopologyNode.title: Node

schematopologySiteMeshGroupType.title: Site Mesh Group

hub.description:
If 'Type' is Spoke, 'Hub' refers to a Site Mesh Group of 'type' Hub.
 Spoke sites connect to all the member sites of Hub Site Mesh Group.
 Hub will be empty when Site Mesh Group type is Hub or Full Mesh.
hub.title: Hub

links.description:
An edge may be composed of multiple links.
 For example, there may be multiple tunnels between a transit gateway and a site and each tunnel
 is represented as individual links. In some cases, we may want to show only one link between 2 nodes,
 eventhough there may be multiple connections/tunnels between these nodes.

topologyMetricSelector.description: MetricSelector is used to specify the list of metrics to be returned in the response.
topologyMetricSelector.title: Metric Selector

edge.description:
List of metrics to be returned for the edges

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
edge.title: Edge Metric Types

end_time.description:
End time of metric data. This field is applicable only if "include_metrics" is set to true.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to start_time+10m
           If start_time is not specified, then the end_time will be evaluated to <current time>

Example: ` "1570197600"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
end_time.title: End time

node.description:
List of metrics to be returned for the nodes

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.repeated.unique: true
node.title: Node Metric Types

start_time.description:
Start time of metric data. This field is applicable only if "include_metrics" is set to true.
 Format: unix_timestamp|rfc 3339

 Optional: If not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to end_time-10m
           If end_time is not specified, then the start_time will be evaluated to <current time>-10m

Example: ` "1570194000"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_time: true
start_time.title: Start time

step.description:
step is the resolution width, which determines the number of the data points [x-axis (time)] to be returned in the response.
 The timestamps in the response will be t1=start_time, t2=t1+step, ... tn=tn-1+step, where tn <= end_time.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

 Optional: If not specified, then step size is evaluated to <end_time - start_time>

Example: ` "5m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.query_step: true
step.title: Step

cloud_resource_id.description: Cloud Resource Identifier for the node. This is only used for node which represent the cloud resource
cloud_resource_id.title: Cloud Resource Id

description.description:
Description of the node.
 This field may or may not be populated depending on the node type and if the user provided description
 while creating the resource.
description.title: Description

level.description:
Level indicates the distance of the node from the root node. A value of 0 indicates the root node.

Example: ` "1"`
level.title: Level

tags.description: List of key/value pairs associated with the node
tags.title: Tags

topologyNodeTypeDCClusterGroup.description:
DC Cluster group is represented as a node in the site topology graph.
In the DCClusterTopology API, dc_cluster_group is represented as a node and all the sites
that are part of the DC Cluster group are represented as edges (site -> dc_cluster_group) in
addition to the edges between the sites (site <-> site).
topologyNodeTypeDCClusterGroup.title: NodeTypeDCClusterGroup

topologyNodeTypeInstance.description: NodeTypeInstance contains details about the instance and the metrics (if requested/available).
topologyNodeTypeInstance.title: NodeTypeInstance

topologyNodeTypeNetwork.description: NodeTypeNetwork contains details about the network and the metrics (if requested/available).
topologyNodeTypeNetwork.title: NodeTypeNetwork

topologyNodeTypeSite.description: NodeTypeSite contains details about the site and the metrics (if requested/available).
topologyNodeTypeSite.title: NodeTypeSite

topologyNodeTypeSiteMeshGroup.description:
Site mesh group is represented as a node in the site topology graph.
In the SiteMeshTopology API, site_mesh_group is represented as a node and all the sites
that are part of the site mesh group are represented as edges (site -> site_mesh_group) in
addition to the edges between the sites (site <-> site). If the site_mesh_group is of type "Spoke",
then the node representing the site_mesh_group will have an edge with another site_mesh_group node
that represents the "Hub" and vice-versa.
topologyNodeTypeSiteMeshGroup.title: NodeTypeSiteMeshGroup

topologyNodeTypeSubnet.description: NodeTypeSubnet contains details about the subnet and the metrics (if requested/available).
topologyNodeTypeSubnet.title: NodeTypeSubnet

topologyNodeTypeTransitGateway.description: NodeTypeTransitGateway contains details about the transit gateway and the metrics (if requested/available).
topologyNodeTypeTransitGateway.title: NodeTypeTransitGateway

metric.description: Metric data for the Transit Gateway.
metric.title: Metric

 - MANAGED: Managed mode

topologyOrchestrationMode.title: Orchestration Mode

topologySiteMeshGroupSummaryInfo.description: Summary information related to the site mesh group
topologySiteMeshGroupSummaryInfo.title: SiteMeshGroupSummaryInfo

edge_status_summary.description: Summary of the edges status between the sites in the site mesh group.
edge_status_summary.title: Edge Summary

link_status_summary.description: Summary of the link status between the sites in the site mesh group.
link_status_summary.title: Link Status Summary

other_connected_site_mesh_group_sites.description:
If the site mesh group is of type "Hub", this field indicates the number of sites in all the spoke mesh groups
 that are connected to this site mesh group.
 If the site mesh group is of type "Spoke", this field indicates the number of sites in the hub as well as the sites
 in other spoke groups that are attached to this hub.
other_connected_site_mesh_group_sites.title: Other Connected Site Mesh Group Sites
other_connected_site_mesh_group_sites.x-displayname: Other Connected Site Mesh Group Sites

sites.description: This field indicates the number of sites that are part of this site mesh group.
sites.title: Sites

topologySiteMeshTopologyRequest.description: Request to get site mesh group topology and the associated metrics.
topologySiteMeshTopologyRequest.title: Site Mesh Group Topology Request

site_mesh_group.description:
Name of the site mesh group

Example: ` "smg-1"`
site_mesh_group.title: Site Mesh Group

topologySiteNetworksResponse.description: List of Networks Associated to Site
topologySiteNetworksResponse.title: Site Networks Response

topologySiteSummaryInfo.description: Summary information related to the site
topologySiteSummaryInfo.title: SiteSummaryInfo

node_info.description: Provides mapping for node, private ip and public ip
node_info.title: node_info

topologySiteTopologyRequest.description: Request to get site topology and the associated metrics.
topologySiteTopologyRequest.title: Site Topology Request

group_dc_cluster_nodes.description:
Option to enable or disable grouping of sites in a DC Cluster group.
 If enabled, then all the sites in a DC Cluster group are returned as a single node in the response.
group_dc_cluster_nodes.title: Group DC Cluster nodes

group_site_mesh_nodes.description:
Option to enable or disable grouping of sites in a site mesh group.
 If enabled, then all the sites in a site mesh group are returned as a single node in the response.
group_site_mesh_nodes.title: Group Site Mesh nodes

level.description:
Level determines the nodes and the corresponding edges to be returned in the response based on its distance from the root node.
 If the level specified in the request is 1, then the response contains the root node (level:0) and all its immediate neighbors (level:1).
 If the level is set to -1, then all the nodes and edges in the topology graph will be returned in the response.

Example: ` "2"`
level.title: Level

node_id.description:
Specifies the node in the topology graph to start the graph traversal.

Example: ` "site:site-1"`
node_id.title: Node Id

topologySubnetSummaryInfo.description: Summary information related to the subnet
topologySubnetSummaryInfo.title: SubnetSummaryInfo

route_tables.description: List of route tables associated with the subnet
route_tables.title: Route Tables

topologySubnetType.description: A canonical form of the subnet.
topologySubnetType.title: Subnet

region.description: Reference to the regions. (Used for GCP)
region.title: Region

topologyTGWRouteTablesResponse.description: List of RouteTables Associated with TGW
topologyTGWRouteTablesResponse.title: TGW Route Tables Response

topologyTopologyResponse.description:
Relationship between the resources associated with a site is represented as a graph, where each resource/entity is
represented as a node (example: Site (CE, RE), Network (VPC, Virtual Network), Subnet, etc.,) and their association is
represented as edges (example: Site (CE) - Site (CE, RE), Network (VPC) - Subnets, etc.,). All edges are directed.
However if 2 nodes have bidirectional connection, (example: Site - Site), there may be 2 edges in the response for the same
pair of nodes.
topologyTopologyResponse.title: Topology Response

edges.description: List of edges in the topology graph
edges.title: Edges

nodes.description: List of nodes in the topology graph
nodes.title: Nodes

step.description:
Actual step size used in the response. It could be higher than the requested step due to metric rollups and the query duration.
 Format: [0-9][smhd], where s - seconds, m - minutes, h - hours, d - days

Example: ` "30m"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.time_interval: true
step.title: step

topologyTransitGatewayType.description: A canonical form of the transit gateway.
topologyTransitGatewayType.title: TransitGateway
